translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: ngas 'chi ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes par bya ba'i don du ston byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'chi ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes
analyzed: ngas 'chi ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes par bya ba'i don du ston byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'chi ba shes pa kun 'byung ba shes
translated: “When I was practicing bodhisattva conduct, I thought, ‘When I have attained unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I will teach beings the knowledge of the arising of the knowledge of death.’

original: pa sems can rnams la ji ltar yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
analyzed: pa sems can rnams la ji ltar yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
translated: Thinking in this way, I accumulated immeasurable various roots of virtue.

original: moonggal gyi bu /🔽sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med cing grangs med /🔽bsam gyis mi khyab /🔽gzhal du med /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu / sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med cing grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab / gzhal du med /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: gzhal gyis mi lang /
analyzed: gzhal gyis mi lang /
translated: in the past, infinite, innumerable, inconceivable, immeasurable, ineffable, beyond fathoming, beyond range, beyond analogy, beyond compare, beyond all calculation, in the past, in a time gone by,🔽in an eon called Ananta­guṇa­sāgara­vikurvaṇa­rāja,🔽in a world called Ratna­saṃbhavā,

original: brjod du med pa'i 'khor ba de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na drang srong phyi ma'i mtha' sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul che zhing gzi brjid che la mthu che ba /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i 'khor ba de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na drang srong phyi ma'i mtha' sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul che zhing gzi brjid che la mthu che ba /
translated: there was a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha called Ratna­meru­śikharadhara­dhvaja.

original: phyi rol gyi lam gyis 'dod pa dag gi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lam gyis 'dod pa dag gi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig byung ngo //
translated: He became free from the attachment of the desire realm through the external path.

original: de gcig pu dben par song ste nang du yang dag 'jog la zhugs nas sems kyi rnam par rtog @430b ba 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
analyzed: de gcig pu dben par song ste nang du yang dag 'jog la zhugs nas sems kyi rnam par rtog @430b ba 'di lta bu dag skyes te /
translated: He went to a solitary place and, sitting in meditation, had this thought:

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa gang gis 'gro ba'i bye brag snang snyam mo //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa gang gis 'gro ba'i bye brag snang snyam mo //
translated: “What is the ripening of karma that causes the various realms to appear?”

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought,

original: sems can sna tshogs pa yin la sems can rnams kyi rgyud kyang sna tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can sna tshogs pa yin la sems can rnams kyi rgyud kyang sna tshogs pa yin te /
translated: “Sentient beings are various, and the mindstreams of sentient beings are also various.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa sna tshogs dag byung bas las sna tshogs dag mngon par 'du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa sna tshogs dag byung bas las sna tshogs dag mngon par 'du byed par 'gyur /
translated: Thus, various afflictions arise, and various karmas are created.🔽Because various karmas are created, various realms appear.

original: las sna tshogs dag mngon par 'du byed pas 'gro ba sna tshogs dag dang / sems can dmyal ba rnams na dmyal ba'i bye brag /
analyzed: las sna tshogs dag mngon par 'du byed pas 'gro ba sna tshogs dag dang / sems can dmyal ba rnams na dmyal ba'i bye brag /
translated: In the hells, there are various types of hell beings.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dag na dud 'gro'i bye brag /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dag na dud 'gro'i bye brag /
translated: In the animal realm, there are various types of animals.

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten dag na gshin rje'i bye brag /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten dag na gshin rje'i bye brag /
translated: In the world of Yama, there are various types of Yama.

original: lha ma yin dag na lha ma yin gyi bye brag /🔽mi dag la mi'i bye brag /
analyzed: lha ma yin dag na lha ma yin gyi bye brag / mi dag la mi'i bye brag /
translated: The demigods have different types of demigods.🔽Humans have different types of humans.🔽

original: lha dag la lha'i bye brag dag snang ngo snyam mo; ;de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽gang gis 'gro ba de dag thams cad bye brag tu mi 'gyur ba'i rtsi sman 'ga' yod dam snyam mo //
analyzed: lha dag la lha'i bye brag dag snang ngo snyam mo; ;de 'di snyam du sems te / gang gis 'gro ba de dag thams cad bye brag tu mi 'gyur ba'i rtsi sman 'ga' yod dam snyam mo //
translated: The gods appear as different kinds of gods, the demigods as different kinds of demigods, and the humans as different kinds of humans.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: ” He thinks, “Is there some kind of medicine that would prevent all these beings from appearing as different kinds of beings?

original: sems can thams cad bdag la rab tu gnas nas nyon mongs pa shin tu bskyed /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag la rab tu gnas nas nyon mongs pa shin tu bskyed /
translated: ” He thinks, “If all beings were to be completely present in me, then the afflictions would be generated in me.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis las mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sems kyis las mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: With an afflicted mind, I would create karmic formations.

original: de dag gi rnam par smin pa sna tshogs grub bo //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par smin pa sna tshogs grub bo //
translated: The various kinds of results of those would be established in me.

original: 'o na bdag gis chos de dag gi bdag gang yin yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na bdag gis chos de dag gi bdag gang yin yongs su btsal bar bya'o //
translated: But I will search for the self that is the basis of those phenomena.

original: snyam nas ci bdag gzugs yin nam /
analyzed: snyam nas ci bdag gzugs yin nam /
translated: ” He thinks, “Am I form?🔽If I were form,

original: gal te re zhig bdag gzugs @431a *//🔽su snang na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig bdag gzugs @431a *//🔽su snang na /
translated: then form would appear to me as a self.

original: gzugs 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa na gang gi tshe bdag 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib par mthong ba da ltar ni /
analyzed: gzugs 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa na gang gi tshe bdag 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib par mthong ba da ltar ni /
translated: When form increases and decreases, you see that the self increases and decreases.

original: ma yin te; de lta bas na /
analyzed: ma yin te; de lta bas na /
translated: But that is not the case now.

original: bdag gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gzugs ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is not form.

original: gal te tshor ba bdag yin na /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba bdag yin na /
translated: If feeling were the self,

original: de gzugs bde ba'i gnas dag la bde bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de gzugs bde ba'i gnas dag la bde bar 'gyur /
translated: when there is a basis for pleasure, pleasure would be the self;

original: yid mi bde ba'i gnas dag la sdug bsngal bar 'gyur /🔽btang snyoms kyi gnas dag la sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i gnas dag la sdug bsngal bar 'gyur / btang snyoms kyi gnas dag la sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: when there is a basis for mental pain, pain would be the self;

original: bde ba'ang ma yin par 'gyur te /🔽bdag gi mtshan nyid ni; de lta bu ma yin pas de lta bas na /
analyzed: bde ba'ang ma yin par 'gyur te / bdag gi mtshan nyid ni; de lta bu ma yin pas de lta bas na /
translated: and when there is a basis for equanimity, the self would be neither painful nor pleasant.🔽But the characteristics of the self are not like that.

original: tshor ba bdag ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba bdag ma yin /
translated: Therefore, feeling is not the self.

original: gal te 'du shes bdag yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'du shes bdag yin na /
translated: If perception were the self,

original: bde ba'i tshor ba dag la bde ba rjes su 'jug par 'gyur; sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag la sdug bsngal rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba dag la bde ba rjes su 'jug par 'gyur; sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag la sdug bsngal rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: when there is a pleasant feeling, pleasure would be the self; when there is a painful feeling, pain would be the self;🔽and when there is a feeling of equanimity, the self would be neither painful nor pleasant.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dag la sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te /🔽gang gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dag la sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba rjes su 'jug par 'gyur te / gang gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: In the case of feelings that are neither pleasant nor painful, feelings that are neither pleasant nor painful will follow.🔽That which follows after is not the characteristic of a self.

original: bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin pas de lta bas na /
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid ma yin pas de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'du shes bdag ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes bdag ma yin /
translated: perception is not the self.

original: gal te 'du byed bdag yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed bdag yin na /
translated: If formations were the self,

original: de dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / mi g-yo ba rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: they would be of three types: wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral.

original: rnam pa gsum @431b po de dag gi rnam par smin pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum @431b po de dag gi rnam par smin pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The karmic maturation of these three types would be pleasant, painful, and neither pleasant nor painful.

original: de la ci bdag dge ba'am /
analyzed: de la ci bdag dge ba'am /
translated: In that case, would the self be wholesome,

original: 'on te mi dge ba'am; 'on te mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: 'on te mi dge ba'am; 'on te mi g-yo ba /
translated: or unwholesome, or neutral?

original: bdag de ni /
analyzed: bdag de ni /
translated: The self would not🔽be any of these.

original: 'gyur bar mi 'dod pas de lta bas na /
analyzed: 'gyur bar mi 'dod pas de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'du byed bdag ma yin /
analyzed: 'du byed bdag ma yin /
translated: formations are not the self.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa bdag yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa bdag yin na /
translated: If consciousness were the self,

original: ci'i phyir bde ba'i tshor ba dag la bde bar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bde ba'i tshor ba dag la bde bar rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Why is it that pleasant feelings are followed by pleasure?

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag la sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag la sdug bsngal gyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Why is it that painful feelings are followed by suffering?

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dag la btang snyoms rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba'ang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dag la btang snyoms rjes su 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Why is it that feelings that are neither painful nor pleasant are followed by equanimity?

original: bdag de ni /
analyzed: bdag de ni /
translated: This self

original: 'gyur bar mi 'dod pas de lta bas na /
analyzed: 'gyur bar mi 'dod pas de lta bas na /
translated: does not wish to change.

original: rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is not the self.”

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽phung po lnga po 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te / phung po lnga po 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: He thinks this:

original: bdag med cing bdag gi ba med de /
analyzed: bdag med cing bdag gi ba med de /
translated: “All of these five aggregates are without a self and without anything that belongs to a self.

original: nyon mongs pa dag las las; las dag las rnam par smin pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag las las; las dag las rnam par smin pa /
translated: From the afflictions arises karma; from karma arises ripening.

original: rnam par smin pa las nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: From ripening arise the afflictions.

original: de ltar gsum po 'di'i rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: de ltar gsum po 'di'i rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: Thus, the continuity of these three is uninterrupted.”

original: de ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas 'khor bzhi rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas 'khor bzhi rnams la chos ston te /
translated: When he rises from that samādhi, he teaches the Dharma to the fourfold assembly, saying:

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

original: 'di la bdag dang bdag gi ba med de /
analyzed: 'di la bdag dang bdag gi ba med de /
translated: There is no self or anything pertaining to a self.

original: rkyen dag yod na /
analyzed: rkyen dag yod na /
translated: When conditions are present,

original: 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur @432a *//
analyzed: 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur @432a *//
translated: formations occur.

original: la; rkyen dag med na /
analyzed: la; rkyen dag med na /
translated: When conditions are absent,

original: 'du byed rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: formations do not occur.

original: de de ltar chos ston pa na sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: de de ltar chos ston pa na sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
translated: When he teaches the Dharma in this way, countless thousands of beings attain acceptance that phenomena are not produced.

original: 'dir 'du byed 'di dag la ma gtogs par chos gang yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'dir 'du byed 'di dag la ma gtogs par chos gang yang skye ba'am /
translated: Here, apart from these formations, there are no phenomena that are produced,

original: 'jig pa'am / 'chi ba med de /
analyzed: 'jig pa'am / 'chi ba med de /
translated: cease, die, or are reborn.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: nyon mongs pa dag las las /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag las las /
translated: from afflictions arise actions,

original: las dag las rnam par smin pa yin no //
analyzed: las dag las rnam par smin pa yin no //
translated: and from actions arise ripened effects.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: All these phenomena

original: ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yin te /
translated: are devoid of an essence.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba /
translated: They are devoid of the essence of afflictions,

original: las kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba /
analyzed: las kyi ngo bo nyid dang bral ba /
translated: devoid of the essence of actions,

original: rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: and devoid of the essence of ripened effects.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

original: de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong phyi ma'i mtha' sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong phyi ma'i mtha' sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that the one who was the sage named Skilled in Establishing the Future was someone else,🔽

original: de ltar mi blta ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: If you think that the one who was the sage named Skilled in Establishing the Limits of the Future was someone else, do not see it in that way.

original: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong phyi ma'i mtha' sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong phyi ma'i mtha' sgrub pa la mkhas pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: At that time, I was the sage named Skilled in Establishing the Limits of the Future.

original: ngas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi gtam de lta bu dag smras pa na sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo; ;moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: ngas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi gtam de lta bu dag smras pa na sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo; ;moonggal gyi bu /
translated: When I spoke such discourses on affliction and karma, countless tens of thousands of beings attained acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: “Therefore, Maudgalyāyana,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @432b 'dod pas las rnam par gzhag pa gsum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar @432b 'dod pas las rnam par gzhag pa gsum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood should train in the three classifications of karma.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: Maudgalyāyana,

original: ngas 'chi ba shes pa 'gog pa shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'chi ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa sems
analyzed: ngas 'chi ba shes pa 'gog pa shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'chi ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa sems
translated: I thought, ‘When I attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, I will teach beings the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of death.’🔽I thought, ‘I will teach beings the knowledge of the cessation of the knowledge of death.’

original: can rnams la ji ltar yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
analyzed: can rnams la ji ltar yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya che ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
translated: For that purpose I created vast, limitless roots of virtue.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na drang srong 'chi ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul che zhing gzi brjid che la mthu che ba; phyi rol gyi
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus 'khor ba dpag tu med pa nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na drang srong 'chi ba shes pa 'gog pa shes pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul che zhing gzi brjid che la mthu che ba; phyi rol gyi
translated: in the past, infinite, countless, incalculable, inconceivable, immeasurable, vast, limitless, ineffable, indescribable eons ago, there was a sage named Knowledge of the Cessation of the Knowledge of Death. He had great miraculous abilities, great splendor, and great power. He was free from the desires of the desire realm

original: lam gyis 'dod pa dag gi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: lam gyis 'dod pa dag gi 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: through the external path.

original: lnga mngon par shes pa zhig byung ste /
analyzed: lnga mngon par shes pa zhig byung ste /
translated: The fifth is the superknowledges.

original: yid kyis 'dus byas thams cad la yod pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad 'jig par rjes su lta ba na de 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: yid kyis 'dus byas thams cad la yod pa dang / 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad 'jig par rjes su lta ba na de 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: When the mind observes the existence of all conditioned things and the destruction of all conditioned things, it thinks like this:

original: gang gis mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa'i chos gang yang yod dam snyam mo //
analyzed: gang gis mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa'i chos gang yang yod dam snyam mo //
translated: “Is there any unarisen or unceasing thing?”

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: It thinks like this:

original: chos gang mngon par 'dus byas pa de 'gog par mi 'gyur la /🔽mngon par 'du mi byed pa la ni /
analyzed: chos gang mngon par 'dus byas pa de 'gog par mi 'gyur la / mngon par 'du mi byed pa la ni /
translated: “That which is conditioned does not cease.

original: 'gog pa med do snyam mo //🔽de de ltar yang dag @433a *//
analyzed: 'gog pa med do snyam mo // de de ltar yang dag @433a *//
translated: That which is unconditioned has no cessation.”

original: pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor rtog pa na mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i chos thams cad la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor rtog pa na mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i chos thams cad la mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: When it correctly discerns in this way, it enters the concentration of the vajra-like samādhi, called “delighting in all unconditioned things.”

original: de rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la rab tu gnas nas sems kyi rgyud la gang dang gang skye ba de dang de sems kyi rgyud nyid la so sor rtog cing rab tu rtog ste /

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /

original: sems gzugs med cing bstan du med pa /
analyzed: sems gzugs med cing bstan du med pa /

analyzed: sems 'gog pa rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa de 'byung zhing sems @433b kyi rgyud rab tu 'jug /

analyzed: sems gang 'gog pa na sems kyi rgyud 'dra bar rab tu 'jug ste /

analyzed: sdang ba'i sems 'gog pa de sems kyi rgyud 'dra bar rab tu 'jug /

analyzed: gti mug gi sems 'gog pa de sems kyi rgyud 'dra bar rab tu 'jug cing sems kyi rgyud la chags pa'am /

analyzed: sems kyi rgyud de dag thams cad rab tu shes so //

analyzed: yongs su shes par byar med /

original: sangs rgyas kyi gdung yang dag par spel /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gdung yang dag par spel /
translated: He extended the lineage of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rgya cher byas te mchod pa byas nas dus byas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung rgya cher byas te mchod pa byas nas dus byas so //
translated: He made the relics of the Tathāgata extensive and made offerings to them, and then he passed away.

original: moonggal @452a *// gyi bu; de lta bas na /
analyzed: moonggal @452a *// gyi bu; de lta bas na /
translated: “Therefore, Maudgalyāyana,

original: byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byas nas phyis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi gdung mi gcad par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byas nas phyis byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya'o //
translated: bodhisattvas should make an effort not to cut off the lineage of the Buddha, and only then should they fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: moonggal gyi bu /🔽ngas 'dod pa'i zag pa shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa sems can rnams la ji ltar
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu / ngas 'dod pa'i zag pa shes par bya ba'i don du sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa sems can rnams la ji ltar
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu bstan par bya snyam nas dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag mngon par 'dus byas so //
translated: in the past, when I was practicing bodhisattva conduct in order to understand the defilements of desire, I thought, ‘After I fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood, how should I teach sentient beings about the understanding of the defilements of desire?’ I then accumulated roots of virtue in various ways, immeasurably.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na rgyal po sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba mdzangs shing gsal la yid gzhungs pa /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na rgyal po sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba mdzangs shing gsal la yid gzhungs pa /
translated: “In the past, long ago, there was a king named Following the Nature of All Beings. He was wise, clear-minded, and intelligent.

original: sems can rnams kyi dbang po'i tshogs rtog pa la mkhas pa zhig byung ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dbang po'i tshogs rtog pa la mkhas pa zhig byung ste /
translated: He was skilled in discerning the faculties of beings.

original: sems can gang dag gzugs la mos pa de dag gi gzugs la 'dod chags pa yang dag pa ji lta bu bzhin rab tu shes /
analyzed: sems can gang dag gzugs la mos pa de dag gi gzugs la 'dod chags pa yang dag pa ji lta bu bzhin rab tu shes /
translated: He knew exactly how beings who were attracted to form were attached to form.

original: de sems can 'di dag gzugs la 'dod chags pas yongs su gdungs shing gzugs @452b la 'dod chags pas bsregs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de sems can 'di dag gzugs la 'dod chags pas yongs su gdungs shing gzugs @452b la 'dod chags pas bsregs pa mthong ngo //
translated: He saw that those beings were tormented by attachment to form and burned by attachment to form.

original: de sems can de dag gi gzugs la 'dod chags spong ba'i thabs sems te /
analyzed: de sems can de dag gi gzugs la 'dod chags spong ba'i thabs sems te /
translated: He thought about the means to help those beings abandon attachment to form.

original: thabs gang gis sems can de dag gzugs la 'dod chags ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa'ang spong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: thabs gang gis sems can de dag gzugs la 'dod chags ma skyes pa mi bskyed pa dang / skyes pa'ang spong bar 'gyur /
translated: He thought, ‘By what means can I cause those beings not to give rise to attachment to form that has not yet arisen and abandon attachment to form that has arisen?

original: sems can 'di dag gzugs la 'dod chags pas shin tu gdungs 'dod chags kyis yongs su bsregs pa'i sems des 'chi ba'i dus byas shing de dag sems can dmyal bar skye bar ma gyur cig /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gzugs la 'dod chags pas shin tu gdungs 'dod chags kyis yongs su bsregs pa'i sems des 'chi ba'i dus byas shing de dag sems can dmyal bar skye bar ma gyur cig /
translated: “These beings are tormented by attachment to form. May they not die with a mind burned by desire and be reborn in the hells.

original: 'dod chags kyi me des shin tu gdungs /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi me des shin tu gdungs /
translated: They are tormented by the fire of desire.

original: de'i rkyen gyis sems can dmyal ba pa'i mes gdungs te /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis sems can dmyal ba pa'i mes gdungs te /
translated: Because of that, they are tormented by the fire of the hells.

original: de dag shin tu gdung ba gnyis kyis 'ching ba'i zhags pa las mi 'grol lo //
analyzed: de dag shin tu gdung ba gnyis kyis 'ching ba'i zhags pa las mi 'grol lo //
translated: They are not freed from the noose of the two torments.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pas skye ba na'ang 'brel /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnod pas skye ba na'ang 'brel /
translated: They are bound by the harm of suffering when they are born.

original: 'chi ba na'ang 'brel /
analyzed: 'chi ba na'ang 'brel /
translated: They are bound when they die.

original: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro ba na'ang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro ba na'ang 'brel to //
translated: They are bound when they go from this world to the next world.”

original: snyam nas de thabs tshol ba na 'di ltar yongs su 'jal te /
analyzed: snyam nas de thabs tshol ba na 'di ltar yongs su 'jal te /
translated: “When he seeks the means, he reflects in this way:

original: byis pa dag rtog pa'i dbang gis gtsang ba'i 'du shes kyis 'ching ste /
analyzed: byis pa dag rtog pa'i dbang gis gtsang ba'i 'du shes kyis 'ching ste /
translated: ‘Fools are bound by the notion of purity through the power of imagination.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo dang bral ba kha dog tsam gnyis pa tsam mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo dang bral ba kha dog tsam gnyis pa tsam mo //
translated: They are only color and shape, devoid of the nature of emptiness.

original: de'ang gcig tu bsdus na /
analyzed: de'ang gcig tu bsdus na /
translated: And when that is gathered into one,

original: mi gtsang ba nyid de /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba nyid de /
translated: It is impure.

original: 'di la gtsang ba nyid gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la gtsang ba nyid gang yang med do //
translated: There is nothing pure in it.

original: mgal me bskor ba snang ba bzhin du log par @453a *//
analyzed: mgal me bskor ba snang ba bzhin du log par @453a *//
translated: Like the appearance of a whirling firebrand, it is grasped wrongly.

original: 'dzin pas 'dod chags 'jug pa gtsang bar 'brel pa de shin tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dzin pas 'dod chags 'jug pa gtsang bar 'brel pa de shin tu 'dzin to //
translated: The connection of desire with the pure is very much grasped.

original: de ltar skye ba na'ang 'brel /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba na'ang 'brel /
translated: Thus, it is connected with birth.

original: rga ba na'ang 'brel /
analyzed: rga ba na'ang 'brel /
translated: It is connected with old age.

original: 'chi ba na'ang 'brel bar byed do //
analyzed: 'chi ba na'ang 'brel bar byed do //
translated: It is connected with death.

original: 'khor bar shin tu rgyug pa dag sngon gyi mtha' mi shes so //
analyzed: 'khor bar shin tu rgyug pa dag sngon gyi mtha' mi shes so //
translated: They do not know the beginning of their running around in cyclic existence.

original: snyam nas de sems can de dag gi gang mi gtsang ba yang dang yang du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu ston to //
analyzed: snyam nas de sems can de dag gi gang mi gtsang ba yang dang yang du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu ston to //
translated: Thus, he teaches the impurity of those sentient beings again and again, just as it is.

original: de de dag gi mi gtsang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu ston pa na sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa rnams kyis mi gtsang bar 'du shes pa yongs su shes shing mi gtsang ba'i blor zhugs /
analyzed: de de dag gi mi gtsang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu ston pa na sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa rnams kyis mi gtsang bar 'du shes pa yongs su shes shing mi gtsang ba'i blor zhugs /
translated: When he teaches the impurity of those sentient beings just as it is, countless thousands of sentient beings understand the perception of impurity, and they enter into the mind of impurity.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes so //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes so //
translated: He understood the nature and reality of phenomena just as they are.

original: yongs su shes nas sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes kyis bzlog nas 'dod pa dag gis 'dod chags dang bral nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes so //
analyzed: yongs su shes nas sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes kyis bzlog nas 'dod pa dag gis 'dod chags dang bral nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes so //
translated: Having understood, he turned away from the perception of impurity and, free from desire, was reborn in the world of Brahmā.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po sems can kun gyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po sems can kun gyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that the one who was King Sarvasattvahṛdaya­anuvartta at that time, on that occasion, was someone else,

original: khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: you should think otherwise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po sems @453b can kun gyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po sems @453b can kun gyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: At that time, on that occasion, I was King Sarvasattvahṛdaya­anuvartta.

original: ngas srog chags khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi gtsang ba'i 'dus shes kyis bzlog nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du bskyed do //
analyzed: ngas srog chags khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag mi gtsang ba'i 'dus shes kyis bzlog nas tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du bskyed do //
translated: I turned away from the filth of the aggregates and brought about the birth of countless tens of thousands of beings in the world of Brahmā.

original: de dag thams cad kyang gzugs kyi rang bzhin rab tu shes shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang gzugs kyi rang bzhin rab tu shes shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to //
translated: All of them understood the nature of form and became irreversible from unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpas gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes par bya /
translated: bodhisattvas should understand the nature of form just as it is.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams la'ang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams la'ang bstan par bya'o //
translated: They should also teach it to sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpas gzugs kyi rang bzhin rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gzugs kyi rang bzhin rab tu shes shing /
translated: When bodhisattvas understand the nature of form

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams la'ang rab tu ston pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams la'ang rab tu ston pa ni /
translated: and also teach it to sentient beings,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will become irreversible from unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: ngas 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du sbyar te yang dag par rab tu bstan pa'i bar du'o //🔽moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: ngas 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du sbyar te yang dag par rab tu bstan pa'i bar du'o // moonggal gyi bu /
translated: I know the cessation of the defilement of desire, and so on, up to I know the cessation of the defilement of ignorance, and so on, up to I know the cessation of the defilement of the volitional formations, and so on, up to I know the cessation of the defilement of the volitional formations as it really is.

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na drang srong chos la nges pa zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul che ba /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na drang srong chos la nges pa zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul che ba /
translated: I know the path leading to the cessation of the defilement of desire, and so on, up to I know the path leading to the cessation of the defilement of ignorance, and so on, up to I know the path leading to the cessation of the defilement of the volitional formations, and so on, up to I know the path leading to the cessation of the defilement of the volitional formations as it really is.

original: gzi @454a *// brjid che ba /🔽mthu che ba /🔽phyi rol gyi lam gyis 'dod pa rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: gzi @454a *// brjid che ba / mthu che ba / phyi rol gyi lam gyis 'dod pa rnams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig byung ngo //
translated: I know the defilement of desire as it really is, I know the origin of the defilement of desire, I know the cessation of the defilement of desire, and I know the path leading to the cessation of the defilement of desire as it really is.🔽I know the defilement of ignorance as it really is, I know the origin of the defilement of ignorance, I know the cessation of the defilement of ignorance, and I know the path leading to the cessation of the defilement of ignorance as it really is.🔽I know the defilement of the volitional formations as it really is, I know the origin of the defilement of the volitional formations, I know the cessation of the defilement of the volitional formations, and I know the path leading to the cessation of the defilement of the volitional formations as it really is.🔽I know the defilement of the volitional formations as it really is, I know the origin of the defilement of the volitional formations, I know the cessation of the defilement of the volitional formations, and I know the path leading to the cessation of the defilement of the volitional formations as it really is.

original: de 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa me long gi dkyil 'khor du snang ba ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa me long gi dkyil 'khor du snang ba ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te /
translated: I know the defilement of the volitional formations as it really is, I know the origin of the defilement of the voli

original: ji ltar me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs kyi rnam pa mthong ba med pa de ltar 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa mthong ba'ang med do //
analyzed: ji ltar me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs kyi rnam pa mthong ba med pa de ltar 'dod pa'i zag pa shes pa kun 'byung ba shes pa mthong ba'ang med do //
translated: Just as the reflection of a form in a mirror is not seen, in the same way, the knowledge of the arising of the defilement of desire is not seen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the thing is not real.

original: chos gang dngos po med pa de spang bar mi bya /
analyzed: chos gang dngos po med pa de spang bar mi bya /
translated: That which is a non-thing should not be abandoned,

original: yongs su shes par mi bya /
analyzed: yongs su shes par mi bya /
translated: should not be fully understood,

original: bsgom par mi bya /
analyzed: bsgom par mi bya /
translated: should not be cultivated,🔽should not be realized.

original: mngon sum du mi bya ba yin na; 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa /
analyzed: mngon sum du mi bya ba yin na; 'di ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa /
translated: In this way, foolish, ordinary people, who are not learned,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan don du gnyer ba de dag de'i rnam pa la spyod par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan don du gnyer ba de dag de'i rnam pa la spyod par snang ngo //
translated: who pursue the qualities of desire, are seen to engage in their aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / me long gi gzugs kyi rnam pa la de ltar tshul bzhin du so sor brtags na /
analyzed: dper na / me long gi gzugs kyi rnam pa la de ltar tshul bzhin du so sor brtags na /
translated: For example, when one properly discerns the reflection of a form in a mirror,

original: mngon par shes pa lnga mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga mngon sum du byas so //
translated: one realizes the five higher knowledges.

original: chos thams cad la'ang me long gi dkyil 'khor du snang ba bzhin du 'du shes thob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la'ang me long gi dkyil 'khor du snang ba bzhin du 'du shes thob bo //

analyzed: de sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa dag bzod pa de la rab tu btsud do //
translated: He established countless thousands of beings in that patience.

original: moonggal @454b gyi bu; de ji snyam du sems /🔽de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong chos la nges pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
analyzed: moonggal @454b gyi bu; de ji snyam du sems / de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong chos la nges pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana, what do you think?

original: khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: If you think that the one who was the ṛṣi named Niyata­dharma at that time, on that occasion, was someone else, you should think otherwise.

analyzed: nga de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong chos la nges pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: I was the ṛṣi named Niyata­dharma at that time, on that occasion.

analyzed: ngas de'i tshe sems can khri phrag dpag tu med pa de dag me long gi dkyil 'khor du snang ba lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la rab tu btsud do //
translated: At that time I established countless thousands of beings in the samādhi that is like a reflection in a mirror.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos so //
translated: I dedicated those roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: de lta bas na; byang chub sems dpas me long gi dkyil 'khor du snang ba lta bu'i chos rnams la sems gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na; byang chub sems dpas me long gi dkyil 'khor du snang ba lta bu'i chos rnams la sems gzhug par bya'o //
translated: therefore bodhisattvas should establish their minds in phenomena that are like reflections in a mirror.”

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor du snang ba lta bu'i chos rnams la sems zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor du snang ba lta bu'i chos rnams la sems zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have entered into the phenomena that appear in the circle of the mirror

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks:

original: mun pa'i tshogs gsum yod na /
analyzed: mun pa'i tshogs gsum yod na /
translated: “If the three groups of darkness exist,

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams kun 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams kun 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: then views arise.🔽If they do not exist,

original: de dag nyid med na; lta bar gyur pa dag mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag nyid med na; lta bar gyur pa dag mi 'byung ngo //
translated: then views do not arise.”

original: mun pa'i tshogs gsum gang zhe na /🔽'das pa'i dus su bdag byung ngam ma byung /
analyzed: mun pa'i tshogs gsum gang zhe na / 'das pa'i dus su bdag byung ngam ma byung /
translated: What are the three groups of darkness?🔽“Did I exist in the past? Or did I not exist in the past?

original: ci 'das pa'i dus su byung nas byung bar gyur tam /🔽bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci 'das pa'i dus su byung nas byung bar gyur tam / bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus su 'byung bar 'gyur ram mi 'gyur /
translated: If I existed in the past, did I exist in the past in such and such a way?🔽Or will I not exist in the future?

original: ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus su byung nas 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci ma 'ongs pa'i dus su byung nas 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: If I will exist in the future, will I exist in the future in such and such a way?🔽Or will I not exist in the future in such and such a way?”

original: da ltar gyi dus 'di la'ang som nyi dang / the tshom du 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus 'di la'ang som nyi dang / the tshom du 'gyur te /
translated: He is doubtful and uncertain even about the present.

original: bdag ci yin /
analyzed: bdag ci yin /
translated: What is the self?

original: bdag ji lta bu zhig /
analyzed: bdag ji lta bu zhig /
translated: What is the self like?

original: ci bdag byung bar gyur tam /
analyzed: ci bdag byung bar gyur tam /
translated: Did the self come into being?

original: ji ltar byung bar gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar byung bar gyur /
translated: How did it come into being?

original: sems can de dag gar song /
analyzed: sems can de dag gar song /
translated: Where have those sentient beings gone?

original: de 'di nas shi nas gar 'gro bar 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: de 'di nas shi nas gar 'gro bar 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: Where will they go after they die here?

original: de bdag yod do //
analyzed: de bdag yod do //
translated: He thinks, “The self exists.”

original: zhes de'i nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes de'i nges par 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes certain about that.

original: de rtag par mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //🔽de sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rtag par lta ba bzhi 'thob ste /
analyzed: de rtag par mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro // de sngon gyi mthar rtog pa rtag par lta ba bzhi 'thob ste /
translated: He becomes fixated on permanence.🔽He conceives of a beginning and obtains four views of permanence.

original: gcig tu rtag par lta ba bzhi 'thob bo //
analyzed: gcig tu rtag par lta ba bzhi 'thob bo //
translated: He obtains four views of permanence.

original: mthar lta zhing smra ba bzhi 'thob /
analyzed: mthar lta zhing smra ba bzhi 'thob /
translated: He obtains four views of the end.

original: 'du shes su @472b lta zhing smra ba bcu drug 'thob /
analyzed: 'du shes su @472b lta zhing smra ba bcu drug 'thob /
translated: He obtains sixteen views of perception.

original: 'du shes su lta ba brgyad 'thob /🔽'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'du shes su lta ba brgyad 'thob / 'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: He obtains eight views of perception.

original: med pa'ang ma yin pa brgyad 'thob /
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin pa brgyad 'thob /
translated: He obtains eight views of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das par lta ba lnga 'thob /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das par lta ba lnga 'thob /
translated: He obtains five views of nirvāṇa in this life.

original: chad par lta ba bdun 'thob ste /
analyzed: chad par lta ba bdun 'thob ste /
translated: He obtains seven views of annihilation.

original: nges pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not become certain.

original: de rgyu med pa'i lta ba gnyis 'thob ste /
analyzed: de rgyu med pa'i lta ba gnyis 'thob ste /
translated: He obtains two views of no cause.

original: nges pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not be certain.

original: ngag 'khrul pa'i lta ba bzhi 'thob ste /
analyzed: ngag 'khrul pa'i lta ba bzhi 'thob ste /
translated: There are four views of the confusion of speech:

original: bdag yod do //
analyzed: bdag yod do //
translated: “The self exists.”

original: zhes nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not be certain.

original: de mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa lnga 'dogs par byed pa chad par lta ba bzhi 'thob ste /
analyzed: de mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa lnga 'dogs par byed pa chad par lta ba bzhi 'thob ste /
translated: There are four views of annihilation in regard to the five aggregates of clinging that are seen in this life:🔽“All of these are annihilated,” and so on.

original: de dag thams cad chad pa dang / rtag pa'i phyogs gnyis la gnas te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad chad pa dang / rtag pa'i phyogs gnyis la gnas te /
translated: These two persons are situated in the two extremes of annihilation and permanence.

original: gang zag gnyis po de dag snyoms par zhugs so; ;rtog ge pa kha cig dag bdag rgyu med pa las byung bar mthong ste /
analyzed: gang zag gnyis po de dag snyoms par zhugs so; ;rtog ge pa kha cig dag bdag rgyu med pa las byung bar mthong ste /
translated: Some logicians see the self as arising without a cause.

original: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang gis sems rtse gcig pa thob kyang 'chi ba mi dran no //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang gis sems rtse gcig pa thob kyang 'chi ba mi dran no //
translated: Through the power of concentration, they attain one-pointedness of mind, but they do not remember death.

original: gang rtog ge pa de dag brtags nas rnam par brjod de 'di skad smra'o //
analyzed: gang rtog ge pa de dag brtags nas rnam par brjod de 'di skad smra'o //
translated: Having investigated, those logicians express this view:

original: rgyu med pa las byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung ste /
translated: “It arises without a cause.

original: de rgyu med pas mi 'gog go /
analyzed: de rgyu med pas mi 'gog go /
translated: Since it is without a cause, it is not stopped.”

original: zhes rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / mtha' med par 'gro ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhes rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / mtha' med par 'gro ba mthong ngo //
translated: They see permanence, annihilation, and the absence of an end.

original: gang gis sems can kun 'byung ba'i rigs pa gzhan gang dag yod dam zhes mtha' gnyis po 'di la brten nas blo rnam par @473a *//
analyzed: gang gis sems can kun 'byung ba'i rigs pa gzhan gang dag yod dam zhes mtha' gnyis po 'di la brten nas blo rnam par @473a *//
translated: What other principles are there for the arising of sentient beings?”🔽In this way, he examines with the wisdom of discernment.

original: dpyod do // de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byas pas shes rab kyi mig skyes nas 'di la sems can med cing nyon mongs pa dag las las /
analyzed: dpyod do // de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byas pas shes rab kyi mig skyes nas 'di la sems can med cing nyon mongs pa dag las las /
translated: “When he properly reflects in this way, the eye of wisdom arises, and he sees that there are no sentient beings here, but only afflictions and actions.

original: las dag las rnam par smin pa yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las dag las rnam par smin pa yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: From the afflictions and actions, the results of evolution come into existence.

original: de las kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de las kyang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: From the results of evolution, consciousness arises.

original: ma rig pa dang / sred pa ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / sred pa ni /
translated: Ignorance and craving🔽are the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa; 'du byed dang srid pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa; 'du byed dang srid pa ni /
translated: Formations and becoming🔽are the fields.

original: zhing / nye bar len pa ni /🔽ser / myu gu ni /
analyzed: zhing / nye bar len pa ni / ser / myu gu ni /
translated: Grasping🔽is the seed.

original: skye ba ste /
analyzed: skye ba ste /
translated: The sprout is birth.

original: de la sdug bsngal dang; rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung zhing de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi shing 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang; rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung zhing de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi shing 'di 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, suffering, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and anxiety arise. In this way, the tree of suffering grows.

original: de bzhin du sngon ma thos pa'i chos 'di rnams la rkyen las ma gtogs pa 'dir chos gang yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon ma thos pa'i chos 'di rnams la rkyen las ma gtogs pa 'dir chos gang yang skye ba'am /
translated: Likewise, with regard to these phenomena that have not been heard previously, apart from conditions, no phenomenon is produced here.

original: 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: 'gag pa med do //
translated: In the same way, in these teachings that have not been heard before, no phenomenon whatsoever arises or ceases, except in dependence on conditions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: “When this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ste /
translated: from the arising of this, that arises.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
translated: with ignorance as condition, there are volitions;

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: with volitions as condition, there is consciousness;

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen nas rga shi'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen nas rga shi'i bar du ste /
translated: with consciousness as condition, there is name and form, and so on up to:

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di 'ba' zhig po 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di 'ba' zhig po 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: with birth as condition, there is the mass of suffering.

original: bdag sems par mi byed /
analyzed: bdag sems par mi byed /
translated: I do not think it,

original: gzhan sems par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan sems par mi byed do //
translated: nor does anyone else think it.

original: de 'di'i rkyen gzhan las ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de 'di'i rkyen gzhan las ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be otherwise, except in dependence on conditions?

original: de bzhin du rga shi'i @473b bar yongs su shes par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rga shi'i @473b bar yongs su shes par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he understands the complete understanding of aging and death.

original: de 'di snyam du sems so //🔽kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems so // kye ma 'jig rten gnas pa 'di ni /
translated: He thinks:🔽“Alas! The world is deluded

original: 'khrul pa'o // snyam nas /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'o // snyam nas /
translated: in this way.

original: de ting nge 'dzin de las langs te 'khor brgya stong phrag du ma'i dbus su 'dug nas chos 'di ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin de las langs te 'khor brgya stong phrag du ma'i dbus su 'dug nas chos 'di ston par byed do //
translated: He then rose from that samādhi and, in the midst of a gathering of many hundreds of thousands, taught this Dharma:

original: grogs po dag /🔽'di la sems can gang skye ba'am /
analyzed: grogs po dag / 'di la sems can gang skye ba'am /
translated: “Friends,

original: 'gag pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa gang yang med de /
translated: here there is no sentient being who is born or ceases.

original: khyed cag chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor rtogs shing /
analyzed: khyed cag chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin so sor rtogs shing /
translated: You should understand the essence of phenomena just as it is.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa de ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa de ni /
translated: The absence of essence

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid do //🔽de chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu ston pa na srog chags khrag khrig grangs med pa dag gis 'di la chos gang yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid do // de chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu ston pa na srog chags khrag khrig grangs med pa dag gis 'di la chos gang yang skye ba'am /
translated: is the essence of phenomena.

original: 'gag pa med par chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par shes shing de dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
analyzed: 'gag pa med par chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par shes shing de dag mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob bo //
translated: When he taught the essence of phenomena, many quintillions of beings understood that no phenomenon arises or ceases, and they understood the essence of phenomena. They attained acceptance that phenomena are unborn.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: de ji snyam du sems //
analyzed: de ji snyam du sems //
translated: what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong shes rab rnyog pa med pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong shes rab rnyog pa med pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan yin par sems na /
translated: If you think that the sage named Unclouded Wisdom at that time, on that occasion, was someone else,

original: khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: you should not regard him in that way.

original: de de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong shes rab brnyog pa med pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: de de'i tshe de'i dus na drang srong shes rab brnyog pa med pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: At that time, on that occasion, I was the sage named Unclouded Wisdom.

original: ngas srog chags khrag khrig grangs med pa de dag ngo bo nyid med pa la rab tu btsud do //
analyzed: ngas srog chags khrag khrig grangs med pa de dag ngo bo nyid med pa la rab tu btsud do //
translated: I introduced those countless hundreds of thousands of quintillions of living beings to the absence of an intrinsic nature.

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: therefore

original: byang chub sems dpa' lta ba rnyogs pa med par bya /🔽ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos @474a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lta ba rnyogs pa med par bya / ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos @474a *//
translated: bodhisattvas should be free of clouded views.

original: rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes par bya /🔽so sor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes par bya / so sor rig par bya'o //
translated: They should understand and realize the nature of phenomena that have no intrinsic nature just as it is.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: Bodhisattvas who understand and realize the nature of phenomena that have no intrinsic nature just as it is

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will quickly become irreversible from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: moonggal gyi bu /🔽ngas lta ba'i zag pa shes pa 'gog pa shes par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu / ngas lta ba'i zag pa shes pa 'gog pa shes par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,🔽I thought, ‘I will teach the cessation of the knowledge of the defilement of views’ …

original: mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bar dang / bdag gis ji ltar yang dag par rab tu bshad par bya snyam pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pa'i bar dang / bdag gis ji ltar yang dag par rab tu bshad par bya snyam pa'i bar du'o //
translated: and so on up to ‘I will teach the cessation of the knowledge of the defilement of views that is the result of volitional action’ …🔽and so on up to ‘I will teach the cessation of the knowledge of the defilement of views that is the result of volitional action that is the result of being accumulated.’

original: moonggal gyi bu /
analyzed: moonggal gyi bu /
translated: “Maudgalyāyana,

original: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na drang srong shes rab mkhas pa zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul che ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus nas de'i pha rol gyi'ang ches pha rol na drang srong shes rab mkhas pa zhes bya ba rdzu 'phrul che ba nas de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: in the past, earlier than that, even further back than that, there was a sage named Prajñākaukṛtya, who had great supernormal knowledge …

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar zhig byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar zhig byung ngo //
translated: and so on up to who was free from desire.

original: de dben par song ste /
analyzed: de dben par song ste /
translated: He went to a solitary place🔽and, having sat down,

original: nang du yang dag bzhag pa dang / sems kyi yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu bskyed de /
analyzed: nang du yang dag bzhag pa dang / sems kyi yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu bskyed de /
translated: he had this thought:

original: kye ma 'jig rten 'di ni /🔽nyon mongs pa yin te /
analyzed: kye ma 'jig rten 'di ni /🔽nyon mongs pa yin te /
translated: ‘Alas, this world is defiled.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba rab tu mi shes so snyam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba rab tu mi shes so snyam mo //
translated: I do not understand how to escape from suffering.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought this and had this thought:

original: sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba @474b gang yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba @474b gang yin /
translated: What is the escape from suffering?

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought this and had this thought:

original: rtog pa las sdug bsngal 'byung zhing yongs su rtog pa med na /
analyzed: rtog pa las sdug bsngal 'byung zhing yongs su rtog pa med na /
translated: Suffering arises from conceptualization. If there were no conceptualization,

original: mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi 'byung ngo //
translated: there would be no suffering.

original: snyam mo // de de ltar rig nas gang gi tshe 'du byed thams cad zhi zhing sred pa dang / 'dod chags ma lus pa dang bral zhing 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni /🔽zhi ba'o // 'di ni /
analyzed: snyam mo // de de ltar rig nas gang gi tshe 'du byed thams cad zhi zhing sred pa dang / 'dod chags ma lus pa dang bral zhing 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa 'di ni / zhi ba'o // 'di ni /
translated: Knowing this, when all formations are pacified, free from all craving and attachment, cessation, nirvāṇa,🔽is peace.

original: gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa'o //
translated: This is sublime.

original: snyam mo // de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: snyam mo // de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought this and had this thought:

original: mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i sems can gang kha cig mya ngan las 'das pa yod dam snyam mo //
analyzed: mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i sems can gang kha cig mya ngan las 'das pa yod dam snyam mo //
translated: “Are there any sentient beings who have not yet attained nirvāṇa?”

original: de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pa na 'du shes 'di lta bu skyes so //
analyzed: de de ltar tshul bzhin yid la byed pa na 'du shes 'di lta bu skyes so //
translated: When he reflected in this way, this thought arose:

original: gal te sems can zhig yod na /
analyzed: gal te sems can zhig yod na /
translated: “If there are sentient beings,

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: there would be nirvāṇa.

original: sems can med pas mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
analyzed: sems can med pas mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
translated: But since there are no sentient beings,🔽there is no nirvāṇa.

original: med do // sems can gyi 'du shes rab las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod de /
analyzed: med do // sems can gyi 'du shes rab las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis gnod de /
translated: The suffering that arises from the perception of sentient beings harms them.

original: 'gro ba dag mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba dag mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba ni /
translated: Those who seek nirvāṇa for beings🔽are not seeking nirvāṇa.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gzhan ma yin zhing phung po gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gzhan ma yin zhing phung po gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The aggregates are not other than nirvāṇa.

original: phung po nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The aggregates themselves are nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: sems can mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The nonapprehension of sentient beings

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yin no snyam mo //
translated: is nirvāṇa.’
